metadata.synopsis: This goblin is a commentator on the much-loved goblin sport of chicken-chasing, which involves chasing a chicken (or later, a much larger owlbear) through a set of posts to score a 'chicken-strike'. She's fanatically devoted to the sport, and expects the same dedication from everyone. She'll invite the player to take part, but only if you make a bet.

12.speaker: Krolla
12.text: No more chicken chasin'.  Seems like it's all about the money for some, and I ain't got any to bet.
12.context: NodeContext: Sullen, sulking - she bet with you and lost all her money, but she's pretending she only cares about the spirit of the game.

19.speaker: Krolla
19.text: They done yammerin' on yet? Ain't chicken-chasin' without a bloody crowd.
19.context: NodeContext: Impatient, surly - her friends are too busy drinking to play her game.

59.speaker: Krolla
59.text: Oi! You're not meant to chase it to death. Now you owe me.
59.context: NodeContext: Furious - you've ruined their game by killing the ball. Shocked that you could do this and demanding money.

150.speaker: Narrator
150.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

196.speaker: Player
196.text: I owe you nothing - I didn't kill it.

204.speaker: Krolla
204.text: You were chasin' it, and now it's dead. Seems clear enough to me - cough up.
204.context: NodeContext: As if explaining things to an idiot - you owe her money and she's not letting you away without it.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: The game's not over. Maybe you can be the next chicken.

99.speaker: Krolla
99.text: You're bloody mad, you are. Go on then - you're just ruinin' the game anyway.
99.context: NodeContext: Shaken, intimidated - still furious at you but knows she can't take you in a fight so opting your spite instead.

0.speaker: Krolla
0.text: First you ruin the game, then you start makin' threats? Right - lads!
0.context: NodeContext: Angry, as if genuinely hurt at how boorish you're being. Tone is 'right, that's it!' and her calling her friends to attack you.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: My people use goblin slaves for their games. They always die too.

77.speaker: Krolla
77.text: S-slaves, you say? Right, look - bird's dead, game's over - let's just leave it at that, yeah?
77.context: NodeContext: This response is spefically to drow elves, who regularly take her kind as slaves. You've reminded her of this fact and she's trying to back out of the confrontation without antagonising you.

186.speaker: Narrator
186.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

178.speaker: Player
178.text: Are you trying to extort a True Soul?

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Are you trying to extort a True Soul?

96.speaker: Krolla
96.text: Eh... you're a True Soul? All that I said before - just... just forget it.
96.context: NodeContext: Licking her lips nervously, realising she's been threatening someone who could effortlessly destroy her. Backtracking, second half of the line making light of the threat she's just made.

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

159.speaker: Narrator
159.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

245.speaker: Narrator
245.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

152.speaker: Narrator
152.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

29.speaker: Krolla
29.text: Just... just a bit o' fun. No disrespect meant.

146.speaker: Narrator
146.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

289.speaker: Narrator
289.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

154.speaker: Krolla
154.context: NodeContext: Snorting derisively - you're trying to convince her of your importance and she's having none of it.

266.speaker: Narrator
266.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

69.speaker: Krolla
69.text: Bloody pisspots over there. Too busy toastin' when there's real entertainment to be had.

25.speaker: Krolla
25.text: Not that bloody hollerin'. Clappin' one another on the back as if they've actually done somethin'.
25.context: NodeContext: Scornful, disgusted at the behaviour of the other goblins as they get distracted by petty things

91.speaker: Krolla
91.text: I'm talkin' about somethin' real. I'm talkin' about... chicken-chasin'.
91.context: NodeContext: Passionate, fanatic about the game - not at all petty in her eyes.

32.speaker: Krolla
32.text: Pff, toast. Clappin' themselves on the back as if they've actually done somethin'.
32.context: NodeContext: Scornful, disgusted at the behaviour of the other goblins as they get distracted by petty things

259.speaker: Krolla
259.text: I'd like to see 'em face a real test. Somethin' like... chicken-chasin'.
259.context: NodeContext: Passionate, fanatic about the game - not at all petty in her eyes.

94.speaker: Krolla
94.text: Well? Brave enough to take on the chicken?
94.context: NodeContext: Sizing you up, challenging you to prove you're tough enough to play the game.

288.speaker: Krolla
288.text: Wonderful! And you got coin to back ya? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
288.context: NodeContext: Delighted to get down to business, assuming you have money to play as a matter of course

127.speaker: Krolla
127.text: What you chattin' to me for?! Chicken ain't gonna chase itself!
127.context: NodeContext: Incredulous, urging you to get into the game.

135.speaker: Krolla
135.text: Well if it ain't our fledgling chicken-chaser. Got a taste for the game now, do ya?
135.context: NodeContext: Considering you. You've earned her respect by playing once before but it was a scam, and she's keen to reel you back in.

155.speaker: Krolla
155.context: NodeContext: Looking around in anticipation of finding and kill the trespasser - murder being the only game better than chicken chasing

161.speaker: Krolla
161.text: Well if it ain't our fledgling chicken-chaser. Got a taste for the game now, do ya?
161.context: NodeContext: Considering you. You've earned her respect by playing once before but it was a scam, and she's keen to reel you back in.

102.speaker: Krolla
102.text: Heh! Nothin' like it, is there? C'mon then, you know the drill - coin on the table.
102.context: NodeContext: Keen to get down to business

247.speaker: Krolla
247.text: Bump your head last time or what? Ain't difficult, mate.
247.context: NodeContext: Squinting at you - she's already explained the rules to me.

202.speaker: Krolla
202.text: You face that beastie down one on one. Gotta chase it through the posts before your time's up.
202.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot showing the game areaNodeContext: Repeating something you should already know

133.speaker: Krolla
133.text: But most importantly - gotta back yourself with some coin. How much you thinkin'?
133.context: NodeContext: Getting to the heart of the matter - the bet.

206.speaker: Krolla
206.text: Playin' it safe, eh? Ain't a game for the meek, mate.
206.context: NodeContext: Chuckling - you're betting a low amount and she's patronising you, assuming you're scared.

80.speaker: Krolla
80.text: But come on, then - let's get a crowd goin'.
80.context: NodeContext: Beckoning you on to follow, keen to start the game.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I'm feeling confident. How about a bigger bet? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

167.speaker: Krolla
167.text: It's your money. Let's get a crowd together to watch you lose it, eh?
167.context: NodeContext: Delighted at how much you're spending, not about to stop you.

182.speaker: Krolla
182.text: Then we ain't got nothin' to talk about, do we?

124.speaker: Krolla
124.text: Mate, we already been through this - no coin, no chase. All right?
124.context: NodeContext: Trying to maintain her patience and failing. Last line is a dismissal through gritted teeth.

286.speaker: Krolla
286.text: You face that chicken down one on one. Gotta chase it through the posts before your time's up.
286.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot showing the game areaNodeContext: Repeating something you should already know

165.speaker: Krolla
165.text: Well, lookie here. Seems like you know your way around the course.
165.context: NodeContext: Reassessing you - you've just proven yourself to be quite good at the game and she's patronising you

198.speaker: Player
198.text: Your rules didn't say anything about fire.

273.speaker: Krolla
273.text: Well who ever heard o' chicken chase without fire? We're not bloody amateurs.
273.context: NodeContext: As if you're just being stupid now. Scornful - you can't play chicken chase without fire, keep up.

147.speaker: Krolla
147.text: Pardon, your what? Think you misunderstood, mate.
147.context: NodeContext: As if you've just said something ridiculous.

187.speaker: Krolla
187.text: Ain't no winnings, cos only a goblin can win chicken-chase. Says so in the rules.
187.context: NodeContext: Shit-eating grin as if she's just played a masterful trick on you. Tone is 'oh, you didn't know?'

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Rules can be broken. And so can goblin bones.

163.speaker: Krolla
163.text: Heh. It were only a joke, mate. Here - no quarrel with ya!
163.context: NodeContext: Intimidated but trying to save face, as if you're making a big deal of nothing

207.speaker: Krolla
207.text: What, can't take a joke? Fine, look-
207.context: NodeContext: As if you're making a big deal of nothing, going to give your money back

115.speaker: Krolla
115.text: Wait - s-someone's nicked me coin! You want yours, help me find the bugger.
115.context: NodeContext: Alarmed, outraged - she went to give you back your money but has discovered it's gone. And all of hers too, which is what she actually cares about

45.speaker: Krolla
45.text: Rules are rules, mate. Walk away while you can, eh?
45.context: NodeContext: Firm, growing serious. You're pushing your luck and her good humour is fading.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: You mistook that for a request. My coin - now.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: We're having fun. Why ruin it now?

74.speaker: Krolla
74.text: Hmm. All right. No need to get weepy over it, like. Here.
74.context: NodeContext: This is a very rare outcome - you've actually found her reason and made her feel bad, but she's petulant and ill-tempered about it.

76.speaker: Krolla
76.text: Oh, I'm still having fun mate. Keep pushin', though - see what 'appens.
76.context: NodeContext: Growing serious - you've told her not to ruin the fun but she's not swayed by your reason, and is growing annoyed at your insistence.

250.speaker: Player
250.text: You'll be returning my coin - and all of yours.

177.speaker: Krolla
177.text: You're - you're a True Soul. Here - i-it were only a bit of fun. All yours.
177.context: NodeContext: Said with dawning horror - she's just realised she's been messing with someone in a position of authority over her and backs down immediately.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: You'll be returning my coin - and all of yours.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Goblins know to keep a civil tongue in the Underdark. Granted, most of them are slaves.

271.speaker: Krolla
271.text: The Underdark? Aye, I've, uh - I've 'ad litter-mates disappear down there.
271.context: NodeContext: Feigning interest but growing nervous - you've reminded her that your species are natural predators to hers, and she's becoming afraid.

230.speaker: Krolla
230.text: Heh. Here, your coin - were only a joke! Heh, rules.
230.context: NodeContext: Handing back your money as if she was just making a joke.

103.speaker: Krolla
103.text: S-slaves? Look, I don't want no trouble. Just take your coin, and -
103.context: NodeContext: Growing nervous. You've just reminded her that your people enslave her kind and she's afraid she's offended you.

123.speaker: Krolla
123.text: A joke, is all. No offence meant.
123.context: NodeContext: Still babbling nervously, hoping you'll leave.

218.speaker: Krolla
218.text: Wait, it's bloody gone. Where the -
218.context: NodeContext: Alarmed, panicked - you frightened her into returning your money, but someone else has stolen it in the meantime.

40.speaker: Krolla
40.text: Look - already lost me coin, ain't lookin' to lose anything else. Let's just leave it there, eh?
40.context: NodeContext: Wheedling, as if talking to someone on the verge of violence.

265.speaker: Player
265.text: You rigged the game. I want my money back.

269.speaker: Krolla
269.text: Do you now? Or what - gonna cry?
269.context: NodeContext: Snorting, unimpressed by your bravado

180.speaker: Krolla
180.text: Well now - you look like a tough'un. But 'ave you got smarts? Skill? Guts?
180.context: NodeContext: Sizing you up as you approach. She's very passionate about this sport, and is challenging you to see if you're worthy.

243.speaker: Krolla
243.text: And you're gonna need it, mate. This ain't your standard dungeon-dive, right. This...
243.context: NodeContext: You've just proclaimed your toughness, but she's absolutely certain you haven't faced anything like what she's about to describe.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: I can handle myself just fine.

283.speaker: Krolla
283.text: No doubt, mate. But this ain't dragons, or demons, or anything else you might've faced. This...
283.context: NodeContext: Indulgent - she doesn't doubt your achievements, but they're kids stuff compared to what she's about to detail to you.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: If you have a point, why don't you just get to it?

141.speaker: Krolla
141.text: Don't hang about, do ya? Maybe that serves you well, out fightin' beasties. But this ain't that. This...
141.context: NodeContext: Considering, impressed at your tenacity. Second line is somewhat patronising - maybe that temper impresses other people, but not her.

98.speaker: Krolla
98.context: NodeContext: Low, intense, excited - as if announcing something grand.

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Well, for starters - that's no chicken. It's an owlbear.

23.speaker: Krolla
23.text: Besides, I reckon it owes us seein' as how it just ate our last chicken.

275.speaker: Krolla
275.text: Reckon it owes us a game. You wanna hear the rules or not?

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Could be fun. What is chicken-chasing, exactly?

263.speaker: Krolla
263.text: Only the greatest game since eggs sprouted legs, mate.
263.context: NodeContext: Playing it up, excited to share this with you.

224.speaker: Krolla
224.text: You just gotta chase the chicken around the course and through the posts - but that ain't all.
224.context: CinematicNodeContext: SHOULD ZOOM OVER TO LOCATION IN QUESTIONNodeContext: As if describing something simple - with a catch.

195.speaker: Krolla
195.text: Gotta do it quick, and alone - any of your mates step in, you lose. Time runs out, you lose.
195.context: NodeContext: Intense - rattling off all the conditions in which you can fail.

140.speaker: Krolla
140.text: Sound easy? It ain't. Come back once those boozehounds are done toastin' - you'll see.
140.context: NodeContext: 'Sound easy' is patronising, as if you're already underestimating the task. Rest of line is deadly serious. She's petulant that she can't proceed until her friends are done drinking.

284.speaker: Krolla
284.text: Sound easy? It ain't. Come back when that half-wit's done wailin' and find out.
284.context: NodeContext: 'Sound easy' is patronising, as if you're already underestimating the task. Rest of line is deadly serious. She's petulant that she can't proceed until her friends are done listening to a nearby singer.

112.speaker: Krolla
112.text: Sound easy? It ain't. Better contenders than you have been bested by the bird.
112.context: NodeContext: 'Sound easy' is patronising, as if you're already underestimating the task. Rest of line is deadly serious. She's petulant that she can't proceed until her friends are done drinking.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You know that's an owlbear, right?

267.speaker: Krolla
267.text: It's got feathers, don't it? A beak?
267.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, disgusted that you're getting bogged down in all the wrong details when there's a game to be played. An owlbear is a savage beast many times larger than a human, let alone the chicken they usually play with.

93.speaker: Krolla
93.text: Besides, I reckon it owes us seein' as how it just ate our last chicken.
93.context: NodeContext: Saying it's only fair that the owlbear take part because it ate the chicken they usually use.

82.speaker: Krolla
82.text: Now you wanna play, or is there a bit o' chicken in you and all?
82.context: NodeContext: Not to be distracted, getting back to the main point. Convinced you're only asking so many questions because you're afraid to play.

188.speaker: Krolla
188.text: Ohoho. Fancy yourself, do ya? Care to pin that claim down with some coin? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

189.speaker: Player
189.text: Oh, come on. Let's make a real wager. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

256.speaker: Player
256.text: I have no desire to gamble.

181.speaker: Krolla
181.text: Then you don't want to play. This game ain't for rattle-guts that don't believe in theirselves.
181.context: NodeContext: Very serious, not to be swayed on this point - if you don't pay, you don't play.

222.speaker: Krolla
222.text: We got the coin, we got the challenger - now we just need a crowd, eh?
222.context: NodeContext: Getting excited about playing, ready to call everyone over.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: If we're going to bet, we may as well go all in. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

55.speaker: Krolla
55.text: Cocky, eh? Maybe you've got the skill to back it up. Or maybe I'm about to make a heap o' coin.
55.context: NodeContext: Impressed by your confidence, eager to take your money.

129.speaker: Krolla
129.text: Let's get a crowd goin' and find out, eh?
129.context: NodeContext: Said with a wink - she's excited and anticipating the game.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I don't have the gold for it.

107.speaker: Krolla
107.text: Then go waste some other bugger's time, eh?
107.context: NodeContext: Irritated, as if making a fake-polite suggestion

81.speaker: Player
81.text: I'm not playing your 'game'. It's barbaric.

208.speaker: Krolla
208.text: No skin off my arse. Just remember you 'ad the chance to be part o' something grand - and you walked away.
208.context: NodeContext: Affront and vague disgust for our lack of dedication - we've just refused to play what she considers the greatest game of all time.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: I'm leaving - and the owlbear's coming with me.

158.speaker: Krolla
158.text: Is ya, now? Reckon I feel differently. Reckon the lads will, too.
158.context: NodeContext: Eyebrows raised - as if being threatened by a child. You're making bold claims she's pretty confident you can't back up.

281.speaker: Player
281.text: You love this game enough to die over it?

241.speaker: Krolla
241.text: Might do. Don't plan on being the dead'un, though - lads!
241.context: NodeContext: Placid, utterly unconcerned by your threats and calling her friends to help kill you.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Feel differently? How about you feel dead?

49.speaker: Krolla
49.text: Hells, fine - just take the fat bird, if it means that much to ya. We'll find another chicken.
49.context: NodeContext: Preceded by a sigh. As if you're making a big deal over something small and she's indulging you, when really you've intimidated her.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I'd be doing you a favour. The beast will only get bigger - and tougher.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: I'd be doing you a favour. Keeping such a large beast fed isn't easy.

20.speaker: Krolla
20.text: Hmm. Bugger did eat our last chicken.
20.context: NodeContext: Considering. She hasn't fully thought through how much trouble keeping this owlbear creature might be and you've convinced her to hand it over.

248.speaker: Krolla
248.text: Right, go on then - fat bird's yours. Don't need the hassle.
248.context: NodeContext: Throwing up her hands, not interested in the complication.

233.speaker: Krolla
233.text: I'll do you a favour, and pretend you ain't trying to steal my chicken.
233.context: NodeContext: Suddenly cold, no longer humouring whatever joke you're making. Very clearly done with you.

270.speaker: Krolla
270.text: Now bugger off - if you ain't playin' you're just wastin' my time.
270.context: NodeContext: Dismissing you - you've taken up enough of her time and you're not even interested in her beloved game.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I'm saying I want to buy it.

111.speaker: Krolla
111.text: Do ya now? And who says you can afford it, eh? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_5_8860ed48-ba5f-4b7b-82bf-f1220f967d41])
111.context: NodeContext: Arched eyebrow, tone is 'oh really?' She's surprised by and suspicous of your offer to buy the owlbear.

166.speaker: Krolla
166.text: Suit yourself. We'll just buy a new chicken. A normal one, not this big fat lump.
166.context: NodeContext: Pretending to be unconcerned, but delighted at the money she just made. Bemused by what a big deal you were making over this animal's safety.

27.speaker: Krolla
27.text: You keep wasting my time, you're gonna have more than coin to worry about.
27.context: NodeContext: Impatient, threatening - implying you stand to lose a lot more than your money if you keep bothering.

193.speaker: Player
193.text: That's a bit steep for me.

5.speaker: Krolla
5.text: You're gonna pay with somethin' else, you keep wastin' my time like this.
5.context: NodeContext: Impatient, threatening - implying you stand to lose a lot more than your money if you keep bothering.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Actually, keep it. It's all yours.

14.speaker: Krolla
14.text: That weren't even in question, mate.
14.context: NodeContext: Snorting with derision - you're trying to save face but she's confident you're not a threat.

105.speaker: Player
105.text: I don't care what you think. I'm not asking.

260.speaker: Player
260.text: I don't care what you think. I'm not asking.

116.speaker: Krolla
116.text: You're a... you're a True Soul?
116.context: NodeContext: With dawning horror - she's been taking an aggressive tone with you and she's just realised you're a figure many ranks above her in the hierarchy.

84.speaker: Krolla
84.text: B-beg pardon. Please, take it. A gift! Reckon it's too fat to run anyway, heh.
84.context: NodeContext: Scared, trying to save her own skin by showing utter capitulation.  Last line is a nervous joke.

183.speaker: Krolla
183.text: Oi! Whatever it is you're doin', you can bloody well stop it.
183.context: NodeContext: Confused but furious, about to attack you. You've tried to influence her thoughts but she's managed to shake free.

85.speaker: Krolla
85.text: Fun? Show a bit of respect, mate. This is serious business.
85.context: NodeContext: She takes this game very seriously

1.speaker: Krolla
1.text: Business we can't be about 'til them fools are done with their speechin'.
1.context: NodeContext: Gesturing over at her friends with disgust - they're too busy drinking to play.

86.speaker: Krolla
86.text: Business we can't be about 'til that half-wit's done wailin'.
86.context: NodeContext: Gesturing over at her friends with disgust - they're too busy listening to a singer to play

190.speaker: Krolla
190.text: Besides - we gotta agree stakes before we begin, don't we? ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
190.context: NodeContext: Pulling you back, explaining you need to place a bet before you can play. As if this should be obvious.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: This is cruel. I won't be part of it.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I have better things to do than chase poultry.

131.speaker: Krolla
131.text: Oh c'mon now, don't be scared. It's a simple game - that's what makes it beautiful.
131.context: NodeContext: Patronising - the only reason she can imagine someone wouldn't want to play if that they're afraid.

144.speaker: Krolla
144.text: You just gotta chase the chicken through the course to the posts there, right?
144.context: CinematicNodeContext: SHOULD ZOOM OVER TO LOCATION IN QUESTIONNodeContext: As if describing something simple - with a catch.

119.speaker: Krolla
119.text: Gotta do it fast, and gotta do it alone. Any of your mates step in, you lose. Time runs out, you lose.
119.context: NodeContext: Intense - rattling off all the conditions in which you can fail.

280.speaker: Krolla
280.text: Simple, see? But not easy, no. Come back when them fools are done speechin' - you'll see.
280.context: NodeContext: Bright and cheery, but warning you not to be overconfident. Annoyed you can't play until the singer everyone is distracted by has gone away.

51.speaker: Krolla
51.text: Simple, see? But not easy, no. Come back when that half-wit's done wailin' and find out.
51.context: NodeContext: Bright and cheery, but warning you not to be overconfident. Annoyed you can't play until the singer everyone is distracted by has gone away.

157.speaker: Krolla
157.text: Simple, like I say - but not easy. Better contenders than you have been bested by that bird.
157.context: NodeContext: Bright and cheery, but warning you not to be overconfident

191.speaker: Krolla
191.text: All right, all right. Take your money.
191.context: NodeContext: A bad loser - you've just beaten her fair and square.

168.speaker: Krolla
168.text: I'd almost swear you're in league with the bloody beast.
168.context: NodeContext: Suspicious at how well you're playing the game.

258.speaker: Krolla
258.text: I swear, I nearly think you're in league with that bloody chicken.
258.context: NodeContext: Suspicious at how well you're playing the game.

200.speaker: Krolla
200.text: Well lookee! That thing works even better'n a chicken. Reckon we won't eat it after all.
200.context: NodeContext: As if announcing a goal in a sporting event

210.speaker: Krolla
210.text: Eh, no more games today, True Soul. We ain't worthy, what with the Absolute on your side and all.
210.context: NodeContext: Nervous, shifty. Explaining in a whiney fashion that they're not playing the game any more - mainly cos they're too frightened of you.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I'll be taking the owlbear too.

217.speaker: Krolla
217.text: Oof. Hard luck, mate. Told you it weren't as easy as it looked.
217.context: NodeContext: As if announcing a goal in a sporting event

192.speaker: Krolla
192.text: That's the spirit! Now show me the coin.
192.context: InternalNodeContext: Checking the bet because jumping to the betting nodes which can be shown to the players during the game alsoNodeContext: Loud, encouraging - but more eager to see your money.

11.speaker: Krolla
11.context: NodeContext: Excited, shouting to the whole field

257.speaker: Player
257.text: I like my chances. I'll bet more. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

39.speaker: Player
39.text: On second thought, I'm done playing.

223.speaker: Krolla
223.text: You got your money, right? Don't want no trouble.
223.context: NodeContext: Afraid but trying to reason with you, doesn't want any more hassle from you.

228.speaker: Krolla
228.text: Bloody bard. Used to be goblins had taste.
228.context: NodeContext: Disgusted at how far her people have fallen. They used to love the sport she loves.

232.speaker: Krolla
232.text: What? Ain't nothin' left to chase, unless you fancy volunteerin'.
232.context: NodeContext: Bored, surly - for one reason or another she can't play the game any more, and there's a dull hostility to her.

246.speaker: Krolla
246.text: What? Ain't nothin' left to chase, unless you fancy volunteerin'.
246.context: NodeContext: Bored, surly - for one reason or another she can't play the game any more, and there's a dull hostility to her.

262.speaker: Krolla
262.text: Hells, that yowlin' bleeds the ears. Is that supposed to be entertainment?
262.context: InternalNodeContext: Only with Chicken, owlbear has higher priority than a human bardNodeContext: Preoccupied, gesturing with disgust at the singing bard.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: I suppose you could do much better.

173.speaker: Krolla
173.text: Don't need to, mate. We already got the greatest art there is - and it ain't no warbling.
173.context: NodeContext: Sullen, scornful - her game is obviously better, and only an idiot would think otherwise.

75.speaker: Krolla
75.context: NodeContext: Said with intensity, as if you should already know and be impressed by the game

219.speaker: Krolla
219.text: He's a distraction. Don't get me wrong - it's funny pokin' 'im and watchin' 'im holler.
219.context: NodeContext: Dismissive of the bard - allowing that being cruel to him is always entertaining, but not as entertaining as her favourite game.

97.speaker: Krolla
97.text: But we got serious business to be about 'ere. Chicken-chasin'.
97.context: NodeContext: Intense, very serious about the game.

276.speaker: Krolla
276.text: Brave enough to take on our new chicken? It's a big'un, but that's just more for the chasin'.
276.context: NodeContext: Sizing you up, challenging you to prove you're tough enough to play the game.
